meanings.definition: A blade that may be fixed to the muzzle of a rifle and used to stab an opponent in hand-to-hand fighting.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers charged with their bayonets ready for battle.
meanings.sent2: The soldier attached the bayonets to his rifle before the mission.
meanings.sent3: The bayonets on the rifles made the enemy think twice about attacking.
meanings.sent4: The bayonets gleamed in the sunlight, a menacing sight for the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of bayonets being fixed echoed through the battlefield.

meanings.definition: A type of knife or dagger that is attached to the muzzle of a rifle for use in hand-to-hand combat.
meanings.sent1: During training, the recruits practiced using bayonets in close combat.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers carried bayonets as a last resort in case of close encounters.
meanings.sent3: The bayonets clanked against each other as the soldiers moved forward.
meanings.sent4: The bayonets were like extensions of the rifles, ready to strike at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the bayonets added a fierce edge to the soldiers' appearance.
